alert.note: Alert for Piscataquis (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 20 at 6:56AM EST until December 20 at 8:00PM EST by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR A DAM FLOODGATE RELEASE NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...River flooding caused by upstream dam release continues. * WHERE...A portion of North Central Maine, including the following county, Piscataquis. * WHEN...Until 100 PM EST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying area near the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 655 AM EST, an upstream floodgate release is expected to cause minor flooding in Abol Bridge Campground. - Abol Bridge Campground and the Appalachian Trail is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Baxter State Park. - Discharge at the Ripogenus Dam is approximately 9957 cfs. - For flood safety visit http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
